summary:
Hello ladies and gentlemen.

So for a while around the internet people have been asking what settings are skyrims settings on the xbox 360 version. So I looked into it and changed some ini settings. And by following this tutorial you can achieve this.
descriptionHtml:
Hello ladies and Gentlemen

[b]WARNING YOU MUST FOLLOW THESE STEPS TO GET THE PERFECT OUTCOME [/b]So for a while around the internet people have been asking what settings are skyrims settings on the xbox 360 version. So I looked into it and changed some ini settings only some for shadows. But it does set your shadows to low but they look pretty good because what I did in the ini. So this just changes your settings and some shadow options in your ini. Now another thing I would recommend doing is dowloading a simple mod that caps your FPS so if you have a PC that can't do 60 FPS all the time, or 50-60 when looking at the ground or sky but when looking forward it drops I would recommend using the cpping mod and cap it at 30 FPS the same as the xbox 360 version.Link to fps cap mod    http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34/?WARNING make backup of your current ini.Install/ 1) place the ini in C:\Users\Kris\Documents\My Games\Skyrim2) If your setting are set to high change them to these.Resolution is up to you.Antialising should be 2 samplesAnisotropic filtering should be OffGO INTO ADVANCED SECTIONChangeTexture quality High but people have been saying xbox is medium but there is small differance.Radial Blur LowShadow detail low (don't worry the ini should make them look good)Decal quantity MediumNo FXAAAnd all water checkboxes offNow start skyrim and you are now playing 360 version.
author: Cutesie
